page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: {Introduction.} Heywood is an industrial town of 27,000 people, part of the Borough of Rochdale. It is not mentioned in the original Domesday book but Rochdale is,as "Recedham".The main industry was textiles, especially the spinning and weaving of cotton. That has now declined and new light industries have developed around the old mills. The motorway system and the proximity of Manchester have led to the growth of a large number of storage depots.Being part of Rochdale is a major factor in the town's recent development and the loss of identity is a real fear.This, and the threat of unemployment, will be some of the concerns we will look at, as well as some possible future trends. We begin by looking at some of the present features that remind us of the past.{ }
